The bonus equals your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1). If the attack misses, you can make one weapon attack against the attacker as part of this reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Living Myth
entries: {@i 20th-level Oath of Heroism feature}
You can now empower yourself with the legends—whether true or exaggerated—told of your great deeds. As a bonus action, you gain the following benefits for 10 minutes:

items: You are blessed with otherworldly comeliness, gaining advantage on all Charisma checks.
Once on each of your turns when you make a weapon attack and miss, you can cause that attack to hit instead.
If you fail a saving throw, you can use your reaction to succeed instead.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Conquest
entries: The Oath of Conquest calls to paladins who seek glory in battle and the subjugation of their enemies. It isn't enough for these paladins to establish order. They must crush the forces of chaos. Sometimes called knight tyrants or iron mongers, those who swear this oath gather into grim orders that serve gods or philosophies of war and well-ordered might. Some of these paladins go so far as to consort with the powers of the Nine Hells. The archdevil Bel, warlord of Avernus, counts many of these paladins called hell knights as his most ardent supporters. Hell knights cover their armor with trophies taken from fallen enemies, a grim warning to any who dare oppose them and the decrees of their lords.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

subclassFeature.name: Conquering Strike
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to break a foe's will. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack as part of the {@action Attack} action, you can also use your Channel Divinity to force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Guided Strike
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to strike with supernatural accuracy. When you make an attack roll, you can use your Channel Divinity to gain a +10 bonus to the roll. You make this choice after you see the roll, but before the DM says whether the attack hits or misses.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Conquest
entries: A paladin who takes this oath has the tenets of conquest seared on the upper arm. A hell knight's oath appears in {@language Infernal} runes, a brutal reminder of vows to the Lords of Hell.

entries.name: Douse the Flame of Hope
entries: It is not enough to merely defeat an enemy in battle. Your victory must be so overwhelming that your enemies will to fight is shattered forever. A blade can end a life. Fear can end an empire.

entries.name: Rule with an Iron Fist
entries: Once you have conquered, tolerate no dissent. Your word is law. Those who obey it shall be favored. Those who defy it shall be punished as an example to all who might follow.

entries.name: Strength Above All
entries: You shall rule until a stronger one arises. Then you must grow mightier and meet the challenge, or fall to your own ruin.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Conquest
entries: Starting at 7th level, you emanate a menacing aura while you're not {@condition incapacitated}. The aura includes your space, extends 10 feet from you in every direction, and is blocked by total cover. Any enemy in the aura has disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Implacable Spirit
entries: Once you reach 15th level, you can no longer be {@condition charmed}.

subclassFeature.name: Invincible Conqueror
entries: At 20th level, you gain the ability to harness extraordinary martial prowess. As an action, you can magically become an avatar of conquest, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You have resistance to all damage.
When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can make one additional attack as part of that action.
Your melee weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Treachery
entries: The Oath of Treachery is the path followed by paladins who have forsworn other oaths or who care only for their own power and survival. Commonly known as blackguards, these profane warriors are faithful only to themselves. Anyone desperate enough to follow one of these paladins does so because, while deceitful, these paladins command great power. Those who follow them without falling prey to their treachery hope to indulge in wanton violence and accumulate great treasure. Many of these paladins pay homage to demon lords, especially Grazz't and Orcus. Even the Lords of Hell are loath to ally with these champions of chaos, but sometimes Baalzebul and Glasya find a kindred spirit in a blackguard's penchant for double dealing and treachery.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

subclassFeature.name: Conjure Duplicate
entries: As an action, you create a visual illusion of yourself that lasts for 1 minute, or until you lose your {@status concentration} (as if you were {@status concentration|CPld|concentrating} on a spell). The illusion appears in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you. The illusion looks exactly like you; it is silent; it is your size, is insubstantial, doesn't occupy its space; and it is unaffected by attacks and damage. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the illusion up to 30 feet to a space you can see, but the illusion must remain within 120 feet of you.

For the duration, you can cast spells as though you were in the illusion's space, but you must use your own senses. Additionally, when both you and your illusion are within 5 feet of a creature that can see the illusion, you have advantage on attack rolls against that creature, given how uncanny the illusion is.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Poison Strike
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to make a weapon deadlier. As a bonus action, you touch one weapon or piece of ammunition and conjure a special poison on it. The poison lasts for 1 minute. The next time you hit a target with an attack using that weapon or ammunition, the target takes poison damage immediately after the attack. The poison damage equals {@dice 2d10} + your paladin level, or 20 + your paladin level if you had advantage on the attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Treachery
entries: A paladin who embraces the Oath of Treachery owes allegiance to no one. There are no tenets of this oath, for it lacks any substance. Those who are unfortunate enough to have close contact with blackguards have observed that a blackguard's overwhelming concern is power and safety, especially if both can be obtained at the expense of others.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Treachery
entries: Starting at 7th level, you emanate an aura of discord, which gives you the following benefits.

entries.name: Cull the Herd
entries: You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that has one or more of its allies within 5 feet of it.

entries.name: Treacherous Strike
entries: If a creature within 5 feet of you misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to force the attacker to reroll that attack against a creature of your choice that is also within 5 feet of the attacker. The ability fails and is wasted if the attacker is immune to being {@condition charmed}.
You can use this ability three times. You regain expended uses of it when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Blackguard's Escape
entries: At 15th level, you have the ability to slip away from your foes. Immediately after you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to turn {@condition invisible} and teleport up to 60 feet to a spot you can see. You remain {@condition invisible} until the end of your next turn or until you attack, deal damage, or force a creature to make a saving throw. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Icon of Deceit
entries: At 20th level, you gain the ability to emanate feelings of treachery. As an action, you can magically become an avatar of deceit, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You are {@condition invisible}.

If a creature damages you on its turn, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to your spell save DC) or you control its next action, provided that you aren't {@condition incapacitated} when it takes the action. A creature automatically succeeds on the save if the creature is immune to being {@condition charmed}.
If you have advantage on an attack roll, you gain a bonus to its damage roll equal to your paladin level.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Conquest v2
entries: The Oath of Conquest calls to paladins who seek glory in battle and the subjugation of their enemies. It isn't enough for these paladins to establish order. They must crush the forces of chaos. Sometimes called knight tyrants or iron mongers, those who swear this oath gather into grim orders that serve gods or philosophies of war and well-ordered might.

Some of these paladins go so far as to consort with the powers of the Nine Hells, valuing the rule of law over the balm of mercy. The archdevil Bel, warlord of Avernus, counts many of these paladins—called hell knights—as his most ardent supporters. Hell knights cover their armor with trophies taken from fallen enemies, a grim warning to any who dare oppose them and the decrees of their lords. These knights are often most fiercely resisted by other paladins of this oath, who believe that the hell knights have wandered too far into darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

subclassFeature.name: Conquering Presence
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to exude a terrifying presence. As an action, you force each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to strike with supernatural accuracy. When you make an attack roll, you can use your Channel Divinity to gain a +10 bonus to the roll. You make this choice after you see the roll, but before the DM says whether the attack hits or misses.

entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries: A paladin who takes this oath has the tenets of conquest seared on the upper arm. A hell knight's oath appears in {@language Infernal} runes, a brutal reminder of vows to the Lords of Hell.

entries: You shall rule until a stronger one arises. Then you must grow mightier and meet the challenge, or fall to your own ruin.

entries: Starting at 7th level, you constantly emanate a menacing aura while you're not {@condition incapacitated}. The aura includes your space, extends 10 feet from you in every direction, and is blocked by total cover.

If a creature is {@condition frightened} of you, its speed is reduced to 0 while in the aura, and that creature takes psychic damage equal to half your paladin level if it starts its turn there. At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Scornful Rebuke
entries: Starting at 15th level, those who dare to strike you are psychically punished for their audacity. Whenever a creature hits you with an attack, that creature takes psychic damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 0) if you're not {@condition incapacitated}.

entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to augment your presence with divine power. As a bonus action, you grant yourself a +5 bonus to Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks for the next 10 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Rebuke the Violent
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to rebuke those who use violence. Immediately after an attacker within 30 feet of you deals damage with an attack against a creature other than you, you can use your reaction to force the attacker to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker takes radiant damage equal to the damage it just dealt. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Redemption
entries: The tenets of the Oath of Redemption hold a paladin to a high standard of peace and justice.

entries.name: Peace
entries: Violence is a weapon of last resort. Diplomacy and understanding are the paths to long-lasting peace.

entries.name: Innocence
entries: All people begin life in an innocent state, and it is their environment or the influence of dark forces that drives them to evil. By setting the proper example, and working to heal the wounds of a deeply flawed world, you can set anyone on a righteous path.

entries.name: Patience
entries: Change takes time. Those who have walked the path of the wicked must be given reminders to keep them honest and true. Once you have planted the seed of righteousness in a creature, you must work day after day to allow that seed to survive and flourish.

entries.name: Wisdom
entries: Your heart and mind must stay clear, for eventually you will be forced to admit defeat. While every creature can be redeemed, some are so far along the path of evil that you have no choice but to end their lives for the greater good. Any such action must be carefully weighed and the consequences fully understood, but once you have made the decision, follow through with it knowing your path is just.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of the Guardian
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can shield others from harm at the cost of your own health. When a creature within 10 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to magically take that damage, instead of that creature taking it. This feature doesn't transfer any other effects that might accompany the damage, and this damage can't be reduced in any way.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Protective Spirit
entries: Starting at 15th level, a holy presence mends your wounds in battle. You regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + half your paladin level if you end your turn in combat with fewer than half of your hit points remaining and you aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

subclassFeature.name: Emissary of Redemption
entries: At 20th level, you become an avatar of peace, which gives you two benefits:

items: You have resistance to all damage dealt by other creatures (their attacks, spells, and other effects).
Whenever a creature hits you with an attack, it takes radiant damage equal to half the damage you take from the attack.

entries: If you attack a creature, cast a spell on it, or deal damage to it by any means but this feature, neither benefit works against that creature until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the North Star
entries: Knights who swear an oath to the north star aid and guide travelers along their way. They take after the star itself, reliable and steadfast in even the darkest of times.

entries.subclassFeature: Tenets of the North Star|Paladin|CPld|North Star|CPld|3

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the North Star
entries: A paladin who takes this oath swears on a star in the sky on a clear night.

entries.name: Show the Way.
entries: It is your duty to guide the lost back onto the righteous path. Otherwise, those who are lost will never find their way.

entries.name: Stand Strong.
entries: Do not waver or break formation. Many rely on you, and for them you must stand strong.

entries.name: Shine in the Night.
entries: Without the light above, the night would be dark. Shine bright and defend against the darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the North Star Spells
rows: {@spell aura of purity}, {@spell guardian of faith}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Blinding Intervention
entries: As an action, you can use your channel divinity to teleport to an unoccupied location within 5 eet of a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. That creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your Paladin Spell Save DC or be {@condition blinded} for up to 1 minute. The creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Also, other creatures of your choice within 5 feet of you after you teleport must also make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn. A creature immune to the blind condition automatically passes this save.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Guiding Starlight
entries: You can use your channel divinity to exude an aura of light. As an action, you can cause your body to emit bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light 10 feet beyond that. This light is sunlight. Hostile creatures within the light can’t benefit from being invisible, and the light reveals the true form of shapechangers and creatures altered through magic.
Additionally, magical darkness does not function within the area of bright light. This light lasts for one minute, or until you end it early as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Light
entries: Starting at 7th level, you emit an aura of starlight around you while you're not {@condition incapacitated}, casting dim light in a 10-foot radius around you. You can activate or suppress this aura as a bonus action.

You and friendly creatures inside the aura have resistance to radiant and necrotic damage, along with advantage on death saving throws, as the light shelters those from the energies of other light and darkness.
Starting at 18th level, this aura’s radius, along with the dim light’s radius, increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: All Seeing
entries: Beginning at 15th level, you are always under the effects of a {@spell see invisibility} spell. Also, for you the {@spell see invisibility} spell has a range of 30 feet, rather than self, allowing you to grant its effects to another creature within range when you cast it.

subclassFeature.name: SuperNova
entries: At 20th level, you gain the ability to become the realization of the end of a star's life. As an action, you can magically infuse yourself with starlight, gaining the following benefits for 1 minutes:

items: You emit bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 60 feet.

Your weapon attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d8} radiant damage on a hit, and a target hit by your weapon attacks are basked in radiant energy until the start of your next turn. For the duration, the creature can’t benefit from being invisible, and attacks made against it are made at advantage if the attack was made within 10 feet of the target. The target also emits dim light out to 10 feet during this duration.
When you use your Divine Smite feature, double the number of dice rolled for the radiant damage.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Ancients
entries: The Oath of the Ancients is as old as the race of elves and the rituals of the druids. Sometimes called fey knights, green knights, or horned knights, paladins who swear this oath cast their lot with the side of the light in the cosmic struggle against darkness because they love the beautiful and life-giving things of the world, not necessarily because they believe in principles of honor, courage, and justice. They adorn their armor and clothing with images of growing things—leaves, antlers, or flowers—to reflect their commitment to preserving life and light in the world.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Wrath
entries: As an action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to conjure grasping spectral vines around nearby creatures. Each creature of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of you must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the {@condition Restrained} condition for 1 minute. A {@condition Restrained} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Warding
entries: At 7th level, ancient magic lies so heavily upon you that it forms an eldritch ward, blunting energy from beyond the Material Plane; you and your allies have resistance to Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant damage while in your Aura of Protection.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Undying Sentinel
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you are reduced to 0 Hit Points and not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 Hit Point instead, and you regain a number of Hit Points equal to three times your Paladin level. Once you use this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a Long Rest.
Additionally, you suffer none of the drawbacks of old age, and you can't be aged magically.

subclassFeature.name: Elder Champion
entries: At 20th level, you can assume the form of an ancient force of nature, taking on an appearance you choose. For example, your skin might turn green or take on a bark-like texture, your hair might become leafy or mosslike, or you might sprout antlers or a lion-like mane.
Using your bonus action, you undergo a transformation. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

items: At the start of each of your turns, you regain 10 hit points.
Whenever you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can cast it using your bonus action instead.
Enemy creatures within 10 feet of you have disadvantage on saving throws against your spells and Channel Divinity options.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest. You can also restore your use of it by expending a 5th-level spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Devotion
entries: The Oath of Devotion binds a paladin to the loftiest ideals of justice, virtue, and order. Sometimes called cavaliers, white knights, or holy warriors, these paladins meet the ideal of the knight in shining armor, acting with honor in pursuit of justice and the greater good. They hold themselves to the highest standards of conduct, and some, for better or worse, hold the rest of the world to the same standards. Many who swear this oath are devoted to gods of law and good and use their gods' tenets as the measure of their devotion. They hold angels—the perfect servants of good—as their ideals, and incorporate images of angelic wings into their helmets or coats of arms.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of Devotion Spells
rows: {@spell protection from evil and good}, {@spell shield of faith}
{@spell freedom of movement}, {@spell guardian of faith}

subclassFeature.name: Sacred Weapon
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to imbue one weapon that you are holding with positive energy. For 1 minute, you add your Charisma modifier to attack rolls you make with that weapon (minimum bonus of +1), and each time you hit with it, you cause it to deal its normal damage type or Radiant damage.
The weapon also emits bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light 20 feet beyond that.
You can end this effect as a Bonus Action. This effect also ends if you aren’t holding or carrying the weapon or if you have the {@condition Incapacitated} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Holy Nimbus
entries: At 20th level, as a bonus action, you can emanate an aura of sunlight. For 1 minute, bright light shines from you in a 30-foot radius, and dim light shines 30 feet beyond that.
Whenever an enemy starts its turn in the aura, that creature takes Radiant damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus plus your Charisma modifier.
In addition, for the duration, you have advantage on saving throws you are forced to make by fiends or undead.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest. You can also restore your use of it by expending a 5th-level spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Vengeance
entries: The Oath of Vengeance is a solemn commitment to punish those who have committed a grievous sin. When evil forces slaughter helpless villagers, when an entire people turns against the will of the gods, when a thieves' guild grows too violent and powerful, when a dragon rampages through the countryside—at times like these, paladins arise and swear an Oath of Vengeance to set right that which has gone wrong. To these paladins—sometimes called avengers or dark knights—their own purity is not as important as delivering justice.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Vow of Enmity
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to utter a vow of enmity against a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. You gain Advantage on attack rolls against the creature for 1 minute.

If the creature drops to 0 Hit Points before the vow ends, you can transfer the vow to a different creature within 30 feet of yourself (no action required). You can make this transfer no more than once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless Avenger
entries: By 7th level, your supernatural focus helps you close off a foe’s retreat. When you hit a creature with an Opportunity Attack, you can reduce the creature’s Speed to 0, and you can then move up to half your Speed as part of the same Reaction. This movement doesn’t provoke Opportunity Attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Avenging Angel
entries: At 20th level, you can assume the form of an angelic avenger. Using your bonus action, you undergo a transformation. For ten minutes, you gain the following benefits:

items: Wings sprout from your back and grant you a flying speed of 60 feet.

You emanate an aura of menace in a 30-foot radius. The first time any enemy creature enters the aura or starts its turn there during a battle, the creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. {@action Attack} rolls against the {@condition frightened} creature have advantage.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest. You can also restore your use of it by expending a 5th-level spell slot (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Glory
entries: Paladins who take the Oath of Glory believe they and their companions are destined to achieve glory through deeds of heroism. They train diligently and encourage their companions so they're all ready when destiny calls.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: {@i 3rd-level Oath of Glory feature}
You gain the following two Channel Divinity options. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how Channel Divinity works.

subclassFeature.name: Peerless Athlete
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to augment your athleticism. For 1 hour, you have Advantage on Strength (Athletics) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks; you can carry, push, drag, and lift twice as much weight as normal; and the distance of your long and high jumps increases by 10 feet (this extra distance costs movement as normal).

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Alacrity
entries: {@i 7th-level Oath of Glory feature}

You emanate an aura that fills you and your companions with supernatural speed, allowing you to race across a battlefield in formation. Your Speed increases by 10 feet, and the Speed of any ally who starts their turn in your Aura of Protection increases by 10 feet until the end of that turn.
When you reach 18th level in this class, the range of the aura increases to 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Beauty
entries: Paladins who swear the Oath of Beauty hold themselves to a lofty standard of excellence, strive to be gleaming beacons of beauty. Some use the power of their graceful visage to inspire the downtrodden. Others become obsessed with their elegant appearance, and use the power of their Oath to manipulate, deceive, and intimidate those they see as beneath them.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Beauty
entries: Whether sworn for altruistic reasons or selfish desires, all who swear this Oath share the following tenets:

entries.name: Elegance
entries: You are to hold yourself to the highest of societal standards and expectations. Reputation can open many doors that remain closed to those of ill repute.

entries.name: Grace
entries: You are a cut above the poor and working class, and you must exemplify that quiet dignity in your combat techniques, leisurely pursuits, and all your public actions.

entries.name: Perfection
entries: Those who swear this Oath should strive always to improve themselves in all areas of their life: not only skill in combat, but also appearance and reputation.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the following Channel Divinity options:

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Elegance
entries: As an action, you touch your holy symbol, and divinely enhance your beauty. For the next hour, whenever you make a {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Persuasion} check, you can treat a roll of 9 or lower on the {@dice d20} as a 10.

subclassFeature.name: Quell the Defiler
entries: As a reaction, when a creature you can see within 30 feet attacks you, you can force the attacker to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, their attack misses, and they are {@condition charmed} by you until the end of your next turn. The charm ends early if you attack the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Elegance
entries: Your elegant visage bend others to your whims. Beginning at 7th level, you gain the following effects within 10 feet of you:

items: Creatures within range have disadvantage on saving throws to resist your enchantment and illusion spells.
You have advantage on any {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Persuasion} checks that targets creatures within range.

entries: At 18th level these features effect creatures within 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Imposing Glance
entries: Your beauty has become terrible for your enemies to behold. Starting at 15th level, when you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to reveal your divine beauty and gain a bonus to your Armor Class equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1), until the the start of your next turn.
You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Paragon of Beauty
entries: At 20th level, you can use an action on your turn to reveal the fullness of divine beauty that dwells within your mortal form. For the next minute, you gain the benefits listed below:

items: You are immune to the {@condition charmed} condition.
When you hit a creature with a weapon attack you deal additional damage equal to your Charisma modifier.
You can cast {@spell charm person} as a 1st-level spell as a bonus action on each turn, without expending a spell slot.

entries: Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again, unless you spend a spell slot of 5th-level or higher to use it an additional time.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Exorcist
entries: Since the dawn of time the mortal world has been plagued by the scourge that is undeath. As ancient as this threat itself, a Brotherhood of paladin's known as Exorcists, have protected the living from the dead. These warriors taint their soul with the foul magic of undeath, and once mastered, they use their dark power to drive back the darkness itself. Giving up any chance of a normal life, Exorcists work tirelessly to prevent the tide of undeath from overwhelming the living.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Exorcist
entries: All those who swear this Oath and join the Brotherhood of Exorcists live their lives by a strict code of conduct:

entries.name: Protect the Living
entries: Life is a precious gift given to mortals. All life, especially the innocent, is to be protected at all costs.

entries.name: Destroy Undeath
entries: The foul monsters created by the dark magics of necromancy are a cruel mockery of life and must be hunted down and destroyed wherever they exist.

entries.name: Selfless Vigil
entries: Those who swear the Oath of the Exorcist renounce their rights to a normal life. They bear no titles or honors, inherit no lands, and have no family or children.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the following Channel Divinity options:

subclassFeature.name: Sinister Insights
entries: As an action, you can grasp your holy symbol to enhance your knowledge of undead creatures. For the next hour, you have advantage on any ability checks you make related to undead creatures or necromancy magic.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Dawn
entries: You can draw forth radiant power from your soul to strike your foes. As a bonus action, you can touch your holy symbol and choose a creature within 30 feet. For the next minute, each time you hit that creature with a weapon attack, you deal an additional {@damage 1d4} radiant damage.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Exorcist Spells
rows: {@spell protection from evil and good}, {@spell sanctuary}
{@spell dispel evil and good}, {@spell holy weapon|XGE}

subclassFeature.name: Spectral Form
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you can use a bonus action to enter a ghostlike state that lasts until the end of your turn. While in this state, you are resistant to all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and you can move through solid objects as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your movement inside an object, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, taking {@damage 1d10} force damage for every 5 feet you traveled.
Once you use this feature you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again, unless you spend a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher to use this feature again.
When you reach 18th level in this class, you can use this feature each turn without expending a use or spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Sundering Strike
entries: Beginning at 15th level, when you deal radiant damage to a creature, that creature cannot regain hit points or become incorporeal until the beginning of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Sacrificial Offering
entries: You can sacrifice your own vitality to resist the grasp of death. Upon reaching 20th level, when you would fall to 0 hit points but are not killed outright, you can expend one of your Hit Dice to drop to 1 hit point instead.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Inquisition
entries: Truth. All dedicated paladins who become Inquisitors have the same goal: reveal what is hidden, and purge the planes of those who obscure the truth. Those who swear this Oath will stop at nothing to accomplish their goals, and no matter how ruthless their actions, they believe they are justified.

Above all else they despise creatures that hide their true intentions or forms. Fiend, celestial, or fey; it matters not to the Inquisitor paladin. Any creature, no matter its goals, that uses its power to deceive mortals, has forfeited their life.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Inquisition
entries: Inquisitor paladins will stop at nothing to discover the truth, and refuse to hide who they are, or what their purpose is.

entries.name: Absolute Truth
entries: The truth is out there, and you must do whatever it takes to bring it to light. Those who obscure the truth deserve punishment, and you will deliver that justice.

entries.name: Immutable Forms
entries: All creatures of the multiverse have a natural form. Those that would seek to physically alter their form or obscure it with magic must be reprimanded.

entries.name: Swift Retribution
entries: Those who break the laws of the multiverse deserve a punishment to fit their crime. A thief may lose a hand, but an oathbreaker may forfeit their life.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: At 3rd level you gain the following Channel Divinity options:

subclassFeature.name: Divine Interrogation
entries: As an action, you can grasp your holy symbol and force a creature you can see within 10 feet, to make an Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, you learn the true name of the creature and it has disadvantage on the first Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw you force it to make within the next minute.

subclassFeature.name: Unexpected Inquisition
entries: On your first turn after rolling initiative, you can use a bonus action to hold aloft your holy symbol and force a number of creatures of your choice equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) within 60 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, creatures that have not yet taken a turn since rolling initiative are surprised.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Unstoppable Inquisition
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you do not tolerate those who would stand in the way of your quest for truth. Once per turn, when you hit a Large or smaller creature with a melee attack, you can force them to make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, they are knocked {@condition prone}, in addition to the normal damage.
At 18th level, this ability can also effect Huge creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Will
entries: You have honed your mind to resist any effects that would restrict your agency or obscure the truth for you. Starting at 15th level, you are immune to the {@condition charmed} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Grand Inquisitor
entries: Upon reaching 20th level, you can use your action to become a divine embodiment of absolute Truth and Law. When you do so, you gain the benefits listed below for one minute:

items: You gain {@sense truesight} out to a 120-foot radius.
All of your attacks trigger your Unstoppable Inquisition.
Any shapechanger hit by one of your attacks reverts to its original form and takes an additional {@damage 2d8} radiant damage.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Liberty
entries: The Oath of Liberty calls paladins to use their power to stand with the oppressed against tyranny. It is not enough to enact justice, but to see that justice is fairly applied to all. Paladins of Liberty are often despised by those who have seized power through nefarious means. Seen as threats to the established order, those who swear this Oath and are often persecuted.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Liberty
entries: A paladin of Liberty often emblazons their oath upon their shield and refuses to hide or obscure what they stand for.

entries.name: Equality
entries: Birth, wealth, and status do not matter. Everyone is equal in your eyes. The mighty should be made low, and the lowly raised up. All people should have access to their basic needs, regardless of their birth, status, or wealth.

entries.name: Freedom
entries: Every creature has a right to be free and equal under the law of the land. Bring freedom to those who are enslaved and bring justice to those who abuse their power.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: At 3rd level you gain the following Channel Divinity options:

subclassFeature.name: Admonish the Tyrannical
entries: As a reaction when a creature deals damage to a creature within 30 feet, you can grasp your holy symbol to rebuke them. For the next minute, the attacker has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn't target you.

subclassFeature.name: Shield the Meek
entries: As a reaction when a creature within 30 feet is hit by an attack, you can grasp your holy symbol, and grant it a bonus to their Armor Class equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1), possibly turning the attack into a miss. This bonus lasts until the beginning of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Liberty Spells
rows: {@spell aura of purity}, {@spell freedom of movement}

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Solidarity
entries: The strength of your convictions protects those who stand alongside you. Starting at 7th level, when an allied creature within 10 feet of you takes damage, the damage is reduced by an amount equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).
At 18th level the range of this ability increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Shelter the Innocent
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can take the {@action Help} action as a bonus action, so long as the target is within your Aura of Solidarity.

subclassFeature.name: Heroic Sacrifice
entries: You can enact the ultimate sacrifice, laying down your life for your allies. At 20th level, you can use an action to distribute your remaining hit points and spell slots among creatures within 60 feet of you, following the rules below:

items: You can divide hit points and spell slots in any increment, among any creatures of your choice within range.
Any hit points you give to creatures that go over their hit point maximum become temporary hit points for them.
For a creature to receive one of your spell slots, they must have an expended a spell slot of the same level or lower.

entries: Immediately after you distribute your remaining hit points and spell slots you fall to zero hit points, and are unconscious but stabilized. Once you use this ability you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Mysticism
entries: Where most paladins swear Oaths to a divine cause or ideal, some swear an Oath to themselves, vowing to awaken their own inner power. Known as Mystic Knights, these paladins spend years in secluded places, mastering the psionic power that lies dormant within their own mind. Once their mind has been awakened, these psionic warriors venture out into the world looking to bring enlightenment to all they meet.

entries.name: Optional Rule: Psionic Spellcasting
entries: For mechanics to match the fantasy of a paladin who uses their inner psionic power to cast spells, replace your Charisma saving throw proficiency, spellcasting ability, multiclassing prerequisites, and any other Charisma-based features from your class or the Oath of Mysticism with Intelligence.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Mysticism
entries: Mystic Knights are extremely disciplined, and live their lives by a strict ascetic code in order to awaken their inner power:

entries.name: Asceticism
entries: In order to draw out the full psionic potential of your mind you must forgo all worldly attachments. Family ties, material wealth, all stand in they way of the mystical.

entries.name: Enlightenment
entries: You must always strive to become the best version of yourself. True enlightenment is realizing your full potential, and helping others to discover their true selves.

entries.name: Knowledge
entries: The ability to reason is what separates mortals from beasts and monsters. Knowledge is the only treasure that can bring one closer to true enlightenment.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the following Channel Divinity options:

subclassFeature.name: Enlightened Spell
entries: When you cast one of your Oath of Mysticism Spells, you can invoke this Channel Divinity to cast it without providing verbal or somatic components, and only material components if they are consumed by the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Smite
entries: When you use your Divine Smite, you can invoke this Channel Divinity. The additional damage of Divine Smite becomes psychic damage, and the creature must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, its speed is halved and it cannot take reactions until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Enlightenment
entries: Your awakened mind exudes a psionic ward. Beginning at 7th level, friendly creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you gain resistance to psychic damage, and have advantage on saving throws to resist being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.
At 18th level the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Rebuke
entries: Starting at 15th level, when a creature within your Aura of Enlightenment hits you with an attack, they take psychic damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Ascension
entries: At 20th level, you can use your action to briefly unleash your mind and take on an ascended luminous form. When you do so, you gain the following benefits for one minute:

items: You become translucent and emit otherworldly bright light, in a 5-foot radius, and dim light 5 feet beyond that.
You gain a flying speed equal to your movement speed.
You gain immunity to psychic damage.

You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your movement inside another object or creature, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, taking {@damage 1d10} force damage for every 5 feet you were forced to travel.

entries: Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again, unless you spend a spell slot of 5th-level or higher to use it an additional time.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Prosperity
entries: Not all paladins pursue lives of virtue or nobility. Some more worldly paladins swear an Oath of Prosperity and dedicate their lives to amassing great material wealth. Often hailing from the merchant class, or acting in the service of a great dragon, Prosperity paladins value gold over all else. To them, each action, decision, and even each life, has a value in gold.

While all those who follow the Oath of Prosperity do look out for themselves, not all operate for entirely selfish reasons. Some see material wealth, and the power that comes with it, as the most direct path to enacting change in the world.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Prosperity
entries: Paladins who swear this Oath adhere to a code that allows them to generate wealth. While some strictly follow the code, others have a more loose view of what constitutes wealth.

entries.name: Benefit
entries: Before you act, you must analyze any possible benefits you could gain, whether material wealth or favors.

entries.name: Investment
entries: View everything you do as an investment. Your actions should have a pay off for you at some point in the future. Debt is a powerful force to wield over another.

entries.name: Profit
entries: Never enter into a bad deal. Each agreement that you take part in must eventually increase your ability to grow your power, influence, wealth, or overall standing in society.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the following Channel Divinity options:

subclassFeature.name: Distilled Fortune
entries: As an action, you can touch your holy symbol to one Large or smaller non-magical object, that is not being worn, carried, or part of a structure. It is transfigured into a tiny precious gemstone worth the exact monetary value of the item.
As an action, a creature can crush the gemstone, causing the object to reappear in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet.

If the object reappears above a creature, the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning damage from the object falling on top of it with magical force if it was Tiny sized, with each additional size larger adding {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning damage up to a maximum of {@dice 8d6} bludgeoning damage. If the object was medium or larger, the creature is also knocked {@condition prone} if they fail the Dexterity saving throw.
You can have a total number of objects transfigured in this way equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). You can't transfigure an additional object while at your maximum.

subclassFeature.name: Vault of Prosperity
entries: When you cast a spell that requires a material component with a gold cost, you can invoke this Channel Divinity to reduce the required cost of the material component by an amount of gold equal to 50 times your level.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Prosperity
entries: Your presence increases the value of spells that aid allies you are invested in. Starting at 7th level, when an allied creature within 10 feet is targeted by a spell of 1st-level or higher that restores hit points, or grants them temporary hit points, they gain additional hit points, or temporary hit points, equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1).
At 18th level the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Fortunate Defense
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can liquidate your investments to protect you from harm. As a reaction when you take damage from a creature you can see, you can crush a gem you gained from Distilled Fortune, and reduce the incoming damage by {@dice 1d10} for each 100 gold the Distilled Fortune gem is worth.
For example, a Distilled Fortune gem that is worth 500 gold would reduce the incoming damage by {@dice 5d10}.

subclassFeature.name: Golden Guardian
entries: At 20th level, you can use your action to take on the form of a Golden Guardian, a true paragon of Prosperity. When you do so, you gain the following benefits for one minute:

items: You gain temporary hit points equal to twice your level.
As a bonus action on each turn, you can grant a creature within your Aura of Prosperity temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).
While you, or any creature, has temporary hit points from this feature they gain a golden sheen and are resistant to all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

entries: Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again, unless you spend a spell slot of 5th-level or higher to use it an additional time.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Shield
entries: While most paladins are known for the wrath they pour out upon their foes, those who swear the Oath of the shield use their power to defend. Known as Divine Shields, these noble warriors stand as protectors of the innocent and defenseless. Bravely placing themselves between their allies and danger, a Shield paladin is an invaluable ally to have on the battlefield.

entries.name: Shield Warrior Fighting Style
entries: The Shield Warrior Fighting Style is available to paladins who wish to take the Oath of the Shield:

entries.name: Shield Warrior
entries: Shields count as martial melee weapons for you. On hit, they deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 2d4} + your Strength modifier. If you are wielding a shield and nothing in your other hand, you gain a +1 bonus to your Armor Class and to damage rolls with your shield attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Shield
entries: Paladins of the Shield become one with the armament from which they draw their name, and their Oath reflects that:

entries.name: Immovable Bastion
entries: When you make a choice, you must stand by your decision. When you vow to defend another, you must stand by them no matter the dangers you may face.

entries.name: Shield the Innocent
entries: You are a shield for the defenseless. Power has been given to you so that you may protect those who cannot protect themselves, especially those who don't know how to fight or are unjustly made victims of violence.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: At 3rd level you gain the following Channel Divinity options:

subclassFeature.name: Divine Aegis
entries: As an action, you can hold aloft your holy symbol and project a shining protective aura that extends in a 10-foot radius from you, which lasts until you move. Any creature of your choice within this radius gains the benefits of half cover.

subclassFeature.name: Holy Abjuration
entries: As a reaction when you take damage from a spell or another magical effect, you can grasp your holy symbol and invoke this Channel Divinity. The damage you would take from the spell or magical effect is reduced by an amount equal to your paladin level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). If this reduces the damage of the spell or effect to zero, the entire spell or effect is dispelled.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Shield Spells
rows: {@spell protection from energy}, {@spell leomund's tiny hut|CPld|tiny hut}
{@spell fire shield}, {@spell otiluke's resilient sphere|CPld|resilient sphere}
{@spell circle of power}, {@spell wall of stone}

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Defense
entries: Your force of will can deflect blows that would harm those who fight by your side. Starting at 7th level, when a creature within 10 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to add your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) to the creature's Armor Class against the triggering attack.
At 18th level the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Adamant Stance
entries: Once you take your stand there is nothing that can force you to move. Starting at 15th level, you cannot be moved against your will. Also, when you are forced to make an ability check to resist being {@condition grappled} you can add your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) to the result of your ability check.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Bulwark
entries: At 20th level, you can use your action to exude the ultimate Divine Aegis of protection in a 30-foot radius from you. When you do so, you gain the following benefits for one minute:

items: You gain temporary hit points equal to your paladin level.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can grant yourself temporary hit points equal to your paladin level.
Creatures within range gain the benefits of half cover.
When a creature within range takes damage, you can choose to take the damage in place of them.

entries: Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again, unless you spend a spell slot of 5th-level or higher to use it an additional time.

subclassFeature.name: The Oathless
entries: Not all paladins are able to hold to their Sacred Oaths. Some break their Oath and fall into evil, becoming Blackguards and Oathbreakers, but not all who falter become paragons of evil. Known as the Oathless, paladins who abandon their divinely appointed cause for reasons other then evil still retain some of their power. They wander the wilds as lost warriors, often becoming bandits and mercenaries. Some quest for purpose, seeking to renew their Oath, while others fall into despair.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Oathless
entries: An Oathless paladin owes allegiance to no one. They hold to no tenets and are loyal to nothing but themselves. Oathless paladins are often selfish, with their own safety and power being their only concern. These lost warriors won't hesitate to obtain what they desire, even at the expense of others.

entries.name: Breaking a Sacred Oath
entries: The difficulty of breaking a Sacred Oath can vary by table and style of play. Depending on the paladin's transgression, a small ritual or penance may be all that is needed to keep their power, but other times their Oath has been broken beyond forgiveness.

When a Paladin breaks their Sacred Oath in such a definitive manner, there are only two options to move forward as a paladin: turn to evil and become an Oathbreaker or blackguard, or remain neutral, or even good, as the Oathless paladin detailed here.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the following Channel Divinity options:

subclassFeature.name: Coward's Escape
entries: As a bonus action, you grasp your holy symbol and force a creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target cannot perceive you in any way for up to 1 minute. They can't see, hear, smell, or sense your presence in any way. This ends early if you attack the creature or target them with a spell.

subclassFeature.name: Selfish Restoration
entries: When you begin your turn you can invoke this Channel Divinity (no action required) to end one of the following conditions currently affecting you: {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned}, or {@condition stunned}. Alternatively, you can choose to immediately regain hit points equal to your paladin level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Devious Counter
entries: You have learned to disable foes who threaten you. Starting at 7th level, when a creature misses you with an attack, you can use your reaction to force it to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it is knocked {@condition prone} and its movement speed is reduced to zero until the start of your next turn.
Upon reaching 18th level, you can use this feature an unlimited amount of times without using your reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Forceful Will
entries: Beginning at 15th level, when you force a creature within 15 feet of you to make a saving throw to resist the effects of an enchantment spell, they have disadvantage on their roll.

subclassFeature.name: Paragon of Dishonor
entries: At 20th level, you can use an action to become a shade of a righteous paladin, gaining the benefits below for 1 minute:

items: You become {@condition invisible}.
You can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.
When a creature misses you with an attack, you can force it to repeat its attack against another creature of your choice within the normal range of its attack.

entries: Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again, unless you spend a spell slot of 5th-level or higher to use it an additional time.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Enlightenment
entries: The Oath of Enlightenment is taken by paladins who seek for learning and growth and to share such knowledge and experience with others. As often as others call them teacher or mentor, they call themselves student and pupil.

These paladins spend much of their time trying to build up others, but they are also dedicated to bettering themselves. As they understand other people, they begin to comprehend their own place in the cosmos on a level rivaled by few. The greatest reach a transcendence that allows them to ignore limitations of the planes, levitating and teleporting as they wish.

Paladins of this oath seek learning as a means to improve their connection to and understanding of their god and the domains of their god’s portfolio. Some carry sketch pads and notebooks to record their learnings, while others might bring mats or wear caps to help them focus as they meditate and ponder on recent discoveries.

entries.name: Tenets of Enlightenment
entries: The tenets of the Oath of Enlightenment teach a paladin to seek learning whenever they can and to share it just as often.

entries.name: Knowledge is Power.
entries: The greater your understanding, the greater your influence.

entries.name: Lifelong Learning.
entries: Enlightenment can only be achieved by persistent curiosity and a humble willingness to learn.

entries.name: Teach the Untaught.
entries: Nothing worth learning should be kept to yourself; your knowledge and experience ought to be shared with the world, that others might learn as you have.

entries.name: Seek First to Understand.
entries: Understanding others is more important than being right. Once you understand them, then you can teach them.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Enrich Understanding
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity as an action to share knowledge and experience with others. As an action, choose one skill, and yourself or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The chosen creature gains proficiency with the chosen skill for 10 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Guiding Strike
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to help teach and direct your allies in their strikes. When you hit with a weapon attack, choose an ally within 10 feet of you. The chosen ally can use its reaction to make one weapon attack with a bonus to the attack roll equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Kindling Aura
entries: Whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you makes an Intelligence check, the creature gains a bonus to the roll equal to your Charisma modifier (with a minimum bonus of +1). You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

Additionally, when an ally within 10 feet of you hits a creature with a weapon attack, you can use your reaction to expend a spell slot and cause the attack to deal radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon’s damage. The damage is {@dice 2d8} for a 1st-level spell slot, plus {@dice 1d8} for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of {@dice 5d8}. The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} if the target is an undead or a fiend, to a maximum of {@dice 6d8}.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Illuminated Mind
entries: You are always under the effects of a {@spell see invisibility} spell, and you have resistance to psychic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Transcendent Soul
entries: {@i 20th-Level Oath of Enlightenment Feature}

You can use your bonus action to assume the form of an enlightened, transcendent being. For 1 minute, you have advantage on all ability checks and saving throws, and you teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you once on your turn as a free action. You can also use Kindling Aura as a reaction without expending a spell slot to let your ally deal {@dice 2d8} radiant damage.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest or until you expend a 5th level spell slot to do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Righteous Fist
entries: While most Paladins stand for justice, some take this more seriously then others. Swearing a Divine Oath, Paladins of the Righteous Fist stand as paragons of justice, and enforce this view of the world with their fists. They hone their bodies into deadly weapons and use their radiant fists to defend the weak and punish those who take advantage of the innocent.

entries.subclassFeature: Tenets of the Righteous Fist|Paladin|CPld|Righteous Fist|CPld|3|CPld

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Righteous Fist
entries: {@i 3rd-Level Oath of the Righteous Fist Feature}
Though Righteous Fist Paladins vary in motivation, they all uphold the same tenets of Justice, Tenacity, and Vigilance:

entries.name: Justice
entries: You will do anything within your power to apply justice to all. You strive to lift up the lowly and seek to punish the wicked.

entries.name: Tenacity
entries: You should never give up while there is even the smallest chance of victory. Fight to your last breath and give all that you have in pursuit of your goals, no matter how small.

entries.name: Vigilance
entries: Never turn a blind eye to the injustices of the world. Always remain watchful for those that would take advantage of the lowly folk or use their power to abuse the common trust.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: {@i 3rd-Level Oath of the Righteous Fist Feature}
You gain the following Channel Divinity options:

subclassFeature.name: Glorious Grip
entries: As an action, you can speak a prayer of power and attempt to grapple a creature of any size within your reach, gaining a +10 bonus to your Strength (Athletics) check. If you use this to grapple a creature one size larger then you or smaller, it is also {@condition restrained} for the duration.

subclassFeature.name: Radiant Fists
entries: As a bonus action you can speak a prayer of power to imbue your fists with divine wrath. For the next minute, your unarmed strikes deal radiant damage in place of the normal bludgeoning damage, and your unarmed strike attack rolls score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20 on the d20.

subclassFeature.name: Fists of Righteousness
entries: {@i 3rd-Level Oath of the Righteous Fist Feature}
Where most Paladins study the weapons of war, you turned your body into a deadly weapon. You gain the benefits below:

items: Your unarmed strikes deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier on hit.
You can use Divine Smite with your unarmed attacks.
You can use any of the Smite spells with your unarmed attacks.
When you are not wielding any weapons or a shield, you can use your bonus action on your turn to make a single unarmed strike or attempt to {@action shove} or {@action grapple} a creature.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Victory
entries: {@i 7th-Level Oath of the Righteous Fist Feature}

Your dedication to the triumph of justice empowers you and your allies. Whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you makes a Strength check, the creature gains a bonus to the roll equal to your Charisma modifier (with a minimum bonus of +1). You must be conscious to grant this bonus.
In addition, the weapon attacks and unarmed strikes of both yourself, and creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you deal an additional {@damage 1d4} radiant damage on hit.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet and the radiant damage increases to {@damage 2d4}.

subclassFeature.name: Overwhelming Smite
entries: {@i 15th-Level Oath of the Righteous Fist Feature}

Your fists are imbued with divine justice. Whenever you hit a creature with an unarmed strike that includes Divine Smite damage, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw against your Paladin Spell save DC. Any creature that is more then one size larger then you has advantage on its Strength saving throw to resist this feature.
On a failed save, the creature is knocked back from you in a straight line a number of feet equal to 10 times the level of the spell slot you expended to use Divine Smite.

subclassFeature.name: Paragon of Righteousness
entries: {@i 20th-Level Oath of the Righteous Fist Feature}
As a bonus action, you can transform into a shining beacon of justice. While transformed you gain the following benefits:

items: The damage die of your unarmed strikes becomes {@dice 1d12}.
You gain a bonus to any Strength (Athletics) checks you make equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1).
When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can take the {@action Dash} action in place of one of your attacks.
When you take the {@action Dash} action, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your turn.
Once per turn when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can use Divine Smite without expending a spell slot, as if you had expended a 1st-level spell slot.

entries: This transformation lasts for 1 minute and ends early if you are {@condition incapacitated}. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again. If you have no uses left you can expend a 5th-level spell slot to transform again.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Unpredictable
entries: The Oath of the Unpredictable binds a paladin to the chaotic whims of wild magic, to the awe-inspiring potential of the arcane, and to the boundless possibilities that come with embracing uncertainty. Often viewed as walking enigmas or magical mavericks, these paladins defy easy categorization. For them, the unknown is a realm to be explored, and chaos is the cosmic loom upon which the fabric of reality is woven. While others may see them as unpredictable or even reckless, these paladins see themselves as agents of possibility, sowing seeds of change and wonder in a world that too often settles for the mundane. They often revere deities of magic, chaos, and transformation, seeing their unpredictable ways as divine inspiration.

entries.subclassFeature: Channel Divinity: Let's have a party!|Paladin|CPld|Unpredictable|CPld|3

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Unpredictable
entries: {@i 3rd-Level Oath of the Unpredictable Feature}
While the practices and credos of these paladins can seem as varied and spontaneous as wild magic itself, most adhere to some or all of the following tenets:

entries.name: Wonderment.
entries: Embrace the awe and mystery that comes with the unknown. Never become jaded or cynical; the world is a place of endless fascination.

entries.name: Freedom.
entries: Do not be confined by the limitations others place upon the world. Break molds, question traditions, and always be open to new experiences.

entries.name: Adaptability.
entries: Life is change, and so too should you be willing to adapt. Whether it's a battle plan gone awry or an unexpected turn in the road, see every obstacle as an opportunity for growth.

entries.name: Courage in Chaos.
entries: Do not fear the unpredictable nature of wild magic; embrace it. The same chaos that can sow destruction can also create, inspire, and revitalize. It is the primal force of transformation.

entries.name: Curiosity.
entries: Ask questions, explore uncharted realms, and never be content with simple answers. Your quest for understanding is as important as any fight against evil.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: {@i 3rd-Level Oath of the Unpredictable Feature}
You gain Oath spells at the Paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Anomalistic Attraction
entries: {@i 3rd-Level Oath of the Unpredictable Feature}

As a bonus action, you tap into the ever-shifting tides of arcane energy that course through the universe, drawing them closer to you. With a whispered incantation or a flourish of your weapon, you create a magnetic pull for chaotic magical energies. For the next minute, any wild magic rolls that occur within 20 feet of you are influenced by your aura of unpredictability. These rolls are made twice, offering a tantalizing choice between alternate realities of magical effect. Note: The choice between the two rolls must be made before the outcome is determined.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Let's Have a Party!
entries: {@i 3rd-Level Oath of the Unpredictable Feature}

With a grand sweep of your arm or a burst of ecstatic laughter, you send a surge of wild magical energy into a designated space, turning it into a fantastical menagerie. As an action, you target a 20-foot cube within 60 feet of you, invoking the whims of fate as you roll on the Wild Magic Paladin Party Table. A cosmic carnival ensues; each creature within the area momentarily shimmers as they are polymorphed into the randomly chosen creature from the table. For the next minute, or until forcibly reverted, the affected beings experience life in an entirely new form. Creatures who are unwilling to participate in this cosmic masquerade may attempt a Wisdom saving throw to resist the transformation, and again at the end of each of their turns thereafter.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Magic Smites
entries: {@i 3rd-Level Oath of the Unpredictable Feature}

When you channel your divine energy through your weapon, the power doesn't merely flow; it bursts in a torrent of arcane unpredictability. As you unleash a smite upon your foes, the very weave of magic shudders and twists, producing effects as awe-inspiring as they are varied. When you smite, you roll on the Smite Effects table that corresponds to the spell slot you are expending. Should your smite be a critical hit, the universe conspires to unleash dual manifestations of wild magic—roll twice on the table and apply both results. You unlock the Level 1 Smite Effects table when you reach 3 levels in Paladin, and subsequent tables at levels 5, 9, 13, and 17.

rows: Your body and weapons are wreathed in flames of white-hot intensity. You are on fire until you use an action to put yourself out or until you smite again. Your attacks deal an extra {@dice 1d6} fire damage, and also set your opponent on fire. At the end of your turn, must make a constitution throw against your own spell save DC or take {@dice 1d6} fire damage. Those caught on fire by you also make this save at the end of their turns against your spell save DC, or take {@dice 1d6} fire damage on a failure, or half on a success.

A swirling mist of iridescent magic envelops you, shimmering in impossible colors. It seems to have a life of its own, unpredictably favoring friends or foes. Roll {@dice 1d3} to determine its bias. On a 1 you and allies within 10 feet of you gain {@dice 1d4} to all attack rolls and saving throws. On a 2 all hostile creatures within 10 feet of you get this bonus. On a 3, you and all creatures within 20 feet of you suffer a {@dice 1d4} penalty to all attack rolls and saving throws. This effect lasts until you smite again, or take a short or long rest.

A palpable pulse of arcane energy ripples through the air, augmenting the force behind your blows. Reality seems to strain under the impact. Until you smite again or take a short or long rest, your attacks deal an extra {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage. Make a contested {@skill athletics} check against the target of the smite. The loser is knocked {@condition prone} and pushed 5ft backwards. A creature two sizes larger than you has advantage on this check.
Magical lightning strikes at the clash of your weapon against your foe. Make a contested {@skill acrobatics} check, the loser takes {@dice 2d8} lightning damage.

Cranky rope. The closest rope to your person angrily wakes up and tries to squeeze the first creature it can. You and the target of your smite must make a contested dexterity saving throw, with the loser becoming {@condition restrained|PHB} by the rope (a rope has 2 HP, and AC 10). At the end of each of their turns, the bound creature may attempt to break out with an {@skill Acrobatics} or {@skill Athletics} check against your spell save DC.

As your weapon strikes true, the air shimmers with verdant light, and from this arcane glow burst forth goodberries. Like magical seeds sown by an invisible sylvan hand, 10 goodberries scatter across the ground, encircling you in a ring of mystic sustenance.

With a nauseating squelch, the very ground beneath you and your foes changes. The air is filled with the acrid smell of oily muck as a shimmering, slippery surface erupts from the ground. As if a portal to a dimension of endless grease had briefly overlapped with your reality. All creatures within 10 feet of you must succeed on a dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. The area is {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and any creature that enters the area or ends its turn there must also succeed on the dexterity saving throw. The grease is a noticeable stain for all time thereafter.
Healing energy flows! Roll {@dice 1d2}. On a 1, {@dice 2d8} healing flows the wrong way into the recipient of your smite. On a 2, you receive it.

As your weapon lands, an almost palpable aura of celestial candor bursts into being around you. Ethereal feathers of light float in the air, and you feel as if an ancient cosmic librarian is watching over you. Within this aura, even the most deceitful find their lies sticking in their throats. A zone of truth follows you until you smite again or take a short or long rest. Anyone who fails this save and lies or tries to conceal information in the zone has their nose extend pinocchio style for the duration.

The elemental planes momentarily converge upon your weapon, each vying for dominance. The tip of your blade or the head of your mace sizzles with interchanging elemental energy. Roll a {@dice 1d4} to determine the type: 1 for Fire, 2 for Cold, 3 for Acid, 4 for Lightning. You and your target both take an extra {@dice 1d6} damage of that type.
Invisible Menace. You become invisible until you attack or cast a spell. If you smite while invisible, you become visible again but deal an extra {@dice 1d8} damage.

Chaotic chicken energy possesses you. You sprout feathers and gain +1 to attack and damage rolls until the target of your smite loses consciousness. You can attack no other creature until one of you hits 0 hp.

The moment your weapon makes contact, you feel an otherworldly ripple, like a stone dropped into a cosmic pond. The air grows either arid and parched, every droplet of moisture winking out of existence, or it becomes thick with the smell of ozone before breaking into perpetual rain. Roll {@dice 1d2}. On a 1, all water within 30 ft of you is destroyed. On a 2, rain falls in a 30-foot cube centered on the point you occupy. It rains here for the rest of the year.

Warding Halo. With a flourish, your smite invokes a sacred geometry of glowing symbols and wards around you, phasing in and out of existence. You are under the effects of protection from evil and good for the next 10 minutes, or until you smite again. Roll a {@dice d20}, on a 1 attacks against the target of the smite instead have disadvantage.

Phasing Strike. You temporarily become ethereal until the start of your next turn. You can pass through walls, creatures, and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, but you can't end your turn inside them.

Your smite creates a dissonant, eerie echo, as if you've struck a chord in the fabric of time itself. The air shimmers around you or your target, and for a brief moment, you catch glimpses of an older or younger self, as the merciless or generous hands of time enact their whims. You or the target of your smite (decided by a {@dice 1d2} roll) ages forward or backward ({@dice 1d2}) by {@dice 1d8} years.

An invisible force erupts from the point of impact, warping gravity within a localized, 10-foot radius sphere until you smite again or one minute passes. All creatures that start in or enter the area have their speed halved and must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
