A ripple of chaotic magic surges down your arm and into your weapon. As it transmutes, you find yourself wielding an object completely incongruous to battle but still imbued with your smite’s deadly energy. Whether it's a banana, a delicate flower, or a humble spoon, it holds the same lethal potential. Your weapon transforms into a random object (roll a {@dice 1d6}: 1=banana, 2=flower, 3=spoon, 4=toy sword, 5=fish, 6=your choice) until the end of your next turn. It retains its damage properties despite its new form.
Chaos reveals all! All invisible creatures are visible within 20 feet of you. This effect lasts until your next long rest.

When your smite lands, threads of magical energy, like golden veins of ore, leap from you to your target. These luminous strands create a temporary but intricate web of arcane connection, making you and your target unwitting partners in magical fate. The next spell that targets either you, or the target of your smite, until you next short or long rest, also targets the other.

A line of roaring, flaming, arcane wrath 30 feet long and 5 feet wide emanates from you, towards, and through, the target of your smite. Each creature in the line, including you, must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 3d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Your skin shimmers with a watery sheen, and you feel the weightlessness of the deep ocean embrace you. Gills materialize on the sides of your neck, and your fingers grow webbed like a water-dwelling creature. For the next hour, you can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Wild magic glows from within your veins triggering a magical transformation of your appearance for the next hour. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a 2+, you decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your statistics change. You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same. On a 1, the DM decides this transformation.
A winged creature of the DMs choice appears. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a 1, it has a message for you. On a 2+, it offers to deliver your message to a person of your choosing.

As your weapon collides with the enemy, your mind briefly taps into the cosmic tapestry of existence, granting you a flash of divine insight. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a 2+, you learn whether the target of your smite has more or less hit points than you, and all its immunities, resistances, and vulnerabilities. On a 1, it is you that is assessed, and attack rolls against you by the target have advantage until the end of it's next turn.

With a flash akin to a supernova, light bursts forth from your weapon as it connects with your foe. The brilliance is blinding. The target of your smite must make a constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for the next minute. They may make the save again to end the effect at the end of each of its turns. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a 1, you must also make this save.

Your smite reverberates with raw magical energy, distorting the space around you like a mirage. Enemies squint and falter as they aim, their blows and bolts veering off course. For the next minute, or until you smite again, all attack rolls against you have disadvantage. At the end of each of your turns, make a constitution saving throw. On a failed save, take {@dice 1d6} thunder damage.

Glorious flames wreath your body for the next minute, shedding light in a 30 foot radius. They don't radiate any heat, however. They just make you look extra super cool. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a 1, the target of your smite instead looks super cool.

Glorious flames wreath your body, shedding light in a 30 foot radius. They DO radiate heat, however, and it doesn't feel extra super cool. It is frightening as the flash burns start melting the skin on your body. All enemies within 30 ft of you must make a wisdom save or become {@condition frightened} of you for the next minute. They may make the save again at the end of each of their turns to end the effect. Make a constitution save. On a failure take {@dice 2d8} fire damage, or half as much on a success.

Celestial Embodiment: As your smite connects, divine power clashes with the chaotic energy within you, causing a temporary metamorphosis. You feel your bones stretch and muscles expand as you ascend to a towering stature, radiating the fearsome essence of both the celestial and the arcane. For a fleeting moment, the fabric of reality shivers, pondering whether to bestow the same boon upon your foe. You grow by 1 size, and are under the 'enlarge' effects of the {@spell enlarge/reduce} spell for the next minute, or until you next smite. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a 1, the target of your smite is also enlarged.

Chaos and divinity roil against each other violently, and bombard your foe, physically reducing them in stature. The target of your smite must make a constitution saving throw. On a failure they are under the 'reduce' effects of the {@spell enlarge/reduce} spell for the next minute or until you next smite. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a 1, you are instead reduced.

Incredibly unlikely lighting dramatically strikes you, and chemistry combines with magic to make you incredibly alluring to your foe. They must make a wisdom saving throw. On a failure, for the next minute, they have disadvantage on {@skill perception} checks to perceive any creature other than you.
A 'suitable' 'steed' (determined by the DM) appears, happy and ready to serve you for the next 10 minutes. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a 1, they instead serve the target of your smite.

Weave’s Whimsy: Your smite reverberates through the ether, catching the attention of the unseen forces that bind magic itself. These energies congeal into a discrete boon, and with a flicker of cosmic intention, bestow it upon a random ally within a 60-foot radius. That creature feels an unexplainable confidence, as though fate itself might be nudged in their favor. In the next hour, after any attack roll, ability check, saving throw, the creature may spend this boon to re-roll the {@dice d20}, and choose which outcome to take.

Zephyrs of the Unfettered: The power of your smite turns into gusts of uncontrollable winds swirling around you. You move with the freedom and swiftness of an unchained tempest, and each strike from your weapon sends forth a gale strong enough to unseat your enemies. As you unleash your fury, there’s a lingering sense that the winds could just as easily turn on you. For the next minute, or until you smite again, you gain a 10 foot bonus to your movement speed, and each time you make a successful weapon attack, your foe must make a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a 1, you instead must make the strength saving throws each time.

For the next hour, a random object on your foe, chosen by the DM, that weighs no more than 10 pounds becomes magically locked in place. It can hold up to 4,000 pounds of weight. More weight causes the object to fall. Otherwise, a creature can use an action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, the creature can move the object up to 10 feet. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a 1, it's a random object on you, decided by the DM.

Cloak of the Unseen: The energies unleashed from your smite ripple through you, making your form waver and blur before vanishing entirely. You become a ghostly agent of chaos, unseen but ever-present. You become invisible until you next attack, cast a spell, or smite again. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a 1, the target of your smite instead becomes invisible.

Steps Between Moments: You feel the limitations of space momentarily lifted as your smite connects. Your form exists in a state of heightened reality where distance becomes a mere suggestion. With a thought, you can will yourself to another spot, bypassing the mundanity of physical movement. For the next minute, you can teleport 20 feet as a bonus action.

Heart of the Magnetar: Your armor and weapons resonate with an unnatural magnetism, pulling at the very essence of metal. The ferrous matter around you feels the pull, and for a moment, all metal-tipped projectiles yearn to veer off their courses and converge upon you. Until the start of your next turn, all ranged attacks within 60 feet using a projectile containing metal are directed at you, with disadvantage.

Your smite lashes out like a bolt of cosmic irony, sapping the very muscles of your enemy. For the next minute, or until you smite again, your target finds their weapon unnaturally heavy, their strikes feeble and lacking their usual might. Their Strength-based attacks are halved in damage. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a 1, the wild magic backfires, draining your own vigor in a twist of chaotic fairness. A creature weakened in this way can make a constitution save at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Disruptive Magic
entries: {@i 7th-Level Oath of the Unpredictable Feature}

Your very presence emanates an aura of magical unpredictability, twisting the arcane currents and defying established magical norms. This capricious energy ripples through the very fabric of the spells cast near you, imbuing them with chaotic potential. When any ally within 10 feet of you casts a single target spell against an enemy, they roll on the corresponding spell level of the Wild Magic Paladin’s Smite Effects tables, up to the highest spell level you have unlocked. For effects that are ‘the target of your smite’, it is the original target of the spell. All effects that end when you next smite, still end when you next smite.

Furthermore, the unstable magical field enveloping you unsettles the focus of your foes. Enemies within your aura find it exceedingly difficult to perform precision magical tasks. They suffer from disadvantage on all checks to counterspell, dispel magic, and maintain concentration. At 18th level, the chaotic reach of your aura expands, covering a radius of 30 feet, further sowing magical uncertainty across the battlefield.

rows: As you channel your smite through your weapon, arcs of magic sear through your veins like liquid stardust, illuminating you in a dazzling display of light and color. A nearly audible rush of energy vibrates around you, like a cosmic hum, charging your very being with unpredictable power. Magic becomes a torrent through your veins, pushing you faster like a shot of adrenaline to your heart. For the next minute, or until you smite again, you are under the effects of the {@spell haste} spell, requiring no concentration. This ends concentration on any current active haste effects on you, and you do not fatigue when it ends. Roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, the target of your smite instead receives this effect.

With the resonating impact of your smite, the very air trembles as dormant energies awaken. From the nearby ground, bones rattle and coalesce or dead flesh stirs, forming into a skeleton or zombie. It looks towards you as if seeking command, its undead essence enlivened by the chaotic magic you've unleashed. The nearest pile of bones or corpse of a creature medium or smaller becomes animate, and rises as a skeleton or zombie, for the next minute, or until you smite again. Roll a {@dice d6}. On a 2+, you can mentally command it with your bonus action. On a 1, it is under the control of the target of your smite.

The moment your smite lands, ethereal figures—each shimmering with a heavenly glow—burst forth from your form like a celestial fountain. They dance and whirl around you, their transparent forms ready to channel your restorative energies at your command. For the next minute, or until you smite again, you can use a bonus action to heal a creature within 30 ft of you for {@dice 2d6} hit points. The first time you use this ability, the original target of the smite that triggered this effect can make an {@skill arcana} check against your spell save DC. On a success, it intercepts your healing magic.

Dark Whispers: As your weapon lands, your smite courses with a malignant force that whispers curses into your foe's very soul. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a 1, choose one ability score. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability score. On a 2, while cursed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against you. On a 3, while cursed, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns. If it fails, it wastes its action that turn doing nothing. On a 4, while the target is cursed, your attacks and spells deal an extra {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage to the target. Roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, you are instead cursed by the target of your smite. This lasts until your next short rest or long rest.

Echoes of the Stormforged: Upon smiting, your weapon thrums with electric anticipation. For the next minute, or until you next smite, the first successful weapon attack you make per turn is echoed by a flash of powerful lightning. All creatures in a 5 ft cube in front of you (facing the target of your smite), must make a dexterity save or take {@dice 3d6} lightning damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. Roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, the lightning is instead centered on you for each of these attacks.
Spacey-wacey. For the next minute, or until you next smite, all creatures within your aura are innately able to teleport up to 20 ft. as a bonus action.

Gifts from the Cosmic Jester: As you smite your foe, the universe decides to play a trick, depositing a mysterious object into your hand or pocket. It might be helpful; it might not. An object, no larger than 1 foot on a side and weighing no more than 10 pounds, determined by the GM, appears in your pocket or your hand. Maybe it’s a sending stone, maybe it’s a banana, maybe it’s a blast disk? Maybe it's a totally random potion? If it’s a consumable item, you can consume it freely as part of this smite. Roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, it instead appears for the target of your smite.

As your smite connects, a rainbow of disorienting lights envelops your target, flickering like a mirage. Their eyes cloud over with shifting colors as the fundamental question—'Who am I fighting?'—infuses their mind, clouded by your enchanting magics. The target must make an intelligence saving throw. On a failure, for the next minute, or until you next smite, it cannot tell friend from foe and experience the effects of the {@spell enemies abound|XGE} spell. It can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns. Roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, you must make the save instead.
You strike your opponent so hard that gravity no longer applies to you. For the next 10 minutes, you have a fly speed of 60 ft. Roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, the target of your smite can also fly.

Your attack completely, and temporarily, disapparates your target, turning them into a gaseous cloud until the end of your next turn. They are under the effects of the {@spell Gaseous Form} spell, regardless of whether they are willing. Roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, you are instead turned into a cloud.

Soul-Woven Tug-of-War: A visible thread of ethereal light links your soul to that of your enemy. Make contested charisma saving throws. The loser suffers {@dice 4d8} necrotic damage, and the winner heals for twice the damage taken.

Your weapon becomes a conduit of cosmic radiance, emitting a 100-foot long and 5-foot wide beam of scintillating light that arcs toward your target. The beam branches into prismatic rays, each more brilliant than the last, filling the air with a spectacle of divine awe. Each creature in the beam must make a dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they take {@dice 6d6} radiant damage, or half as much on a success. Make a constitution saving throw. On a failure, you are {@condition blinded} until the start of your next turn.

With a burst of emerald light, flora within a 100-foot radius centered on you surges towards the heavens in an unnatural eruption of growth. Vines writhe and trees arch, making the area a labyrinthine tangle. Creatures find themselves ensnared by this sudden lushness, their progress slowed as they fight through the thickened foliage. A creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.

Physics reels against the extra connection you have to magic. Roll a {@dice d4}. All enemies in a 60 foot cone originating from you must make a strength saving throw. On a failure they take {@dice 5d6} force damage, or half as much on a success. On a 1, they are pulled up to 20 feet closer to you. On a 2, they are pushed up to 20 feet away. On a 3, you are pulled 30 ft in the direction towards the target of your smite, unless a wall or other structure would obstruct you, and you and the target of your smite both fall {@condition prone}. On a 4, you choose from the previous three options.

The nearest corpse explodes with parasites and carnivorous bugs. All creatures within 5 ft of the corpse must make a dexterity save. On a failure they take {@dice 3d8} piercing damage and bugs infest their bodies, causing them to take {@dice 2d8} piercing damage at the beginning of each of their turns, until they, or an adjacent creature, spends an action to remove them. On a success they take half damage.

As your smite finds its mark, reality around you seems to shudder, as if protesting the bending of its laws. In a blink, you feel as if you've grabbed hold of the fabric of time itself, pulling it taut and slowing the essence of your enemies within a localized vortex of distorted chronology. All creatures in a 20 foot cone originating from you, towards the target of your smite, must make a wisdom saving throw. On a failure, for the next minute, or until you smite again, the creature is under the effects of the {@spell slow} spell. Roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, you must also make the wisdom save.

Magic blasts the language center of your brain. Until your next long rest, you can speak with all animals, and the dead, whether you want to or not. The animals and dead are aware of your ability to understand them, but no one but you can perceive the communication.

Battle magic connects you and your foes in a way that most relationships cannot compare. For the next minute, or until you smite again, you can actively read and detect all the thoughts of the target of your smite. Roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, they can read yours.

As your weapon connects, reality itself seems to reject your presence. You're pulled into the ghostly, shifting landscape of the ethereal plane at the end of each of your turns. With each attempt to return, you feel the disorienting pull of two realms in conflict, like an anchorless ship tossed on a stormy sea. Make a Charisma save at the beginning of each of your turns, taking {@dice 1d6} psychic damage on a failure from the metaphysical strain of being yanked back to the material plane.

Your smite disrupts the very weave of magic itself, making the air buzz and shimmer with instability. Arcane and divine energies twist and snap erratically, as if rebelling against the logic and structure imposed by their casters. For the next minute, or until you next smite, all spells within 30 feet of you have a 50% chance of failure. The spell slot is consumed regardless of its success.

Magic no likey that damage. Roll a {@dice d10}. Until you short or long rest, all allies within your aura gain resistance to the damage type rolled. 1-Acid, 2-Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing, 3-Cold, 4-Fire, 5-Force, 6-Lightning and Thunder, 7-Necrotic, 8-Poison, 9-Psychic, 10-Radiant. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, all enemies within your aura gain this resistance as well.

You smack that mother fucker into another plane. The target of your smite must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished for as long as you continue to believe you crushed them so hard they don't belong here. The target of your smite is banished under the same conditions as the {@spell banishment} spell. If you smite again before 1 minute has passed, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. Each time you take damage within this minute you must pass a successful concentration check for the effect to persist. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, you instead are banished and return at the end of your next turn.

Ethereal tendrils, glowing like the first light of dawn, stretch forth to weave a complicated network around creatures of your choice. The tendrils pulse in tandem with your heartbeat, directing the ensnared creatures as you will it. Creatures of your choice that you can see within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, for the next Freedom , or until you smite again, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to designate a direction that is horizontal to you. Each affected target must use as much of its movement as possible to move in that direction on its next turn. It can take its action before it moves. After moving in this way, it can make another Wisdom saving throw to try to end the effect. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, you must also use your movement to move in this direction.

Your smite ripples through the fabric of reality itself, distorting {@skill perception} and confounding the minds of those in its path. As if viewing the world through a warped lens, your enemies find their thoughts muddled, their actions dictated by the mercurial fluctuations of the magic you've unleashed. All creatures in a 20 foot cone originating from you towards the target on your smite must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, for the next minute, or until you smite again, a creature is under the effects of the {@spell confusion} spell. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, all allies within 10 ft of you must instead make this save.

As your weapon strikes true, a pulse of energy radiates outward, causing the earth beneath you to groan and tremble as though awakened from an age-old slumber. Cracks form in the ground, and for a brief moment, the very soil seems eager to disrupt the footing of your enemies. For the next minute, or until you smite again, each enemy standing on the ground within 30 ft of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure they take {@dice 4d6} bludgeoning damage and are moved 10 feet in a random direction. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, you lose your footing, and must also make the saving throws.

Friends! Roll a {@dice d10}. With a resounding crash, the sky splits open above you to unleash a burst of radiant fireworks. Amidst the brilliant pyrotechnics, a form begins to materialize—a creature summoned from a realm beyond, ready to heed your command. The corresponding creature appears for the next minute or until it’s hp drops to 0. It rolls its own initiative and has its own turns, but obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don’t issue any commands to it, it defends itself from hostile creatures, but otherwise takes no actions. 1-{@creature Barbed Devil}, 2-{@creature Barlgura}, 3-{@creature Bulette}, 4-{@creature Carnivorous Flower|RoT}, 5-{@creature Dragonblood Ooze|FTD}, 6-{@creature Giant Crocodile}, 7-{@creature Hill Giant}, 8-{@creature Mammoth}, 9-{@creature Shambling Mound}, 10-{@creature Triceratops}. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, the creature is hostile towards everyone.

Arcs of electricity and tendrils of flame coil around you like serpents of energy, interlocking to form an elemental shield. With each beat of your heart, the energy crackles louder, poised to lash out in retribution. You gain resistance to fire and lightning until the next time you take damage, at which point it explodes off of you in a  5-foot wide, 90-foot long line. Each creature within the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d6} fire and {@dice 3d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1 you must make a constitution saving throw, or also take this damage.

High above, a flicker of divine light condenses into ethereal motes of angelic dust, descending with solemn grace upon you or a random ally within 30 feet. The dust embraces them like a celestial shroud, ready to snatch them back from the precipice of doom. The first time they would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, they instead drop to 1 hit point. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, a random enemy within 30 feet also receives this protection.

Magic will not allow you to be tied down by any means.The wind hums a tune of unshackled freedom, allowing you to move unimpeded, as if in harmony with the very essence of liberty. For the next hour, you are under the effects of the {@spell freedom of movement} spell. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, the weight of the power of magic slows you down. Instead, everywhere is considered {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and you have disadvantage on saves that would paralyze, restrain, or reduce your speed in any way. You can make a Charisma save at the end of each turn to break this effect.

Like a whispered secret lost in the wind, your form blurs and then vanishes entirely. Though you tread upon the earth, none may perceive you; you have become a living enigma, invisible even as you weave your spells or strike your foes. For the next minute, or until you smite next, you are invisible and casting spells and making attacks do not break this effect. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, the target of your smite also becomes invisible in this manner.

With a guttural roar, your physical form swells and contorts, and bark and leaves envelope your skin. Your features sharpen into a warrior-plant visage, terrifying and awe-inspiring. Thorns jut out from the earth around you, creating a maze of {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for your enemies, as you gain the stamina and resilience of an ancient tree. For the next minute, or until you next smite, you take on the terrifying and mighty image of a warrior-tree-person. You gain 10 temporary hit points, you make Constitution saving throws with advantage, you make Dexterity- and Wisdom-based attack rolls with advantage, and while you are on the ground, the ground within 15 feet of you is {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for your enemies. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, you are vulnerable to slashing and fire damage.

With a howl of glacial winds, your smite calls upon the spirits of ancient, ice-wreathed dragons. Relentless and savagely cold winds pick up from behind you, pushing you into your enemies. All enemies in a 30 foot cone originating from you towards the target of your smite must make Dexterity saving throws, taking {@dice 1d8} bludgeoning damage and {@dice 3d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half on a successful one, from the barrage of hailstones and biting blows. The area becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, you are frozen solid in place and {@condition restrained|PHB} until the beginning of your next turn.

Improbability rules all and your body instantaneously erupts into a new form. Roll a {@dice d10} and {@spell polymorph} into the corresponding number. This lasts for the next hour, until you smite again, or your new form is reduced to 0 hp. 1-{@creature Barbed Devil}, 2-{@creature Barlgura}, 3-{@creature Bulette}, 4-{@creature Carnivorous Flower|RoT}, 5-{@creature Dragonblood Ooze|FTD}, 6-{@creature Giant Crocodile}, 7-{@creature Hill Giant}, 8-{@creature Mammoth}, 9-{@creature Shambling Mound}, 10-{@creature Triceratops}. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1 the target of your smite is instead transformed. They may make a Wisdom saving throw to resist the effect.

The spirit of an angelic phoenix totem descends from the heavens and plummets into your back, wreathing you in radiant light. For the next minute, or until you smite again, you are resistant to necrotic damage and whenever a creature within 10 feet of you hits you with an attack, the light sears brightly at that creature, dealing {@dice 2d8} radiant damage. When the effect ends, suffer {@dice 2d8} necrotic damage as the alliance between you and the phoenix give it new life. Wings expand from your shoulder blades and a living phoenix emerges and takes flight.

The marshmallow plane collides with your world in a 15 foot cube adjacent to you. For the next 10 minutes, or until you smite again, the area is now {@quickref difficult terrain||3} and when a creature moves into this area for the first on on a turn or starts it’s turn there, it must succeed on a constitution saving throw or take {@dice 4d10} poison damage from the sickeningly sweet confection being forced into their bodies, and suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion|PHB} as they are fatigued trying to move through. Any levels of {@condition exhaustion|PHB} end when this effect does. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, the cube is centered on you.

Divine bitch smack. You flourish, and catch the target of your smite with the most humiliating strike possible and stagger them in disbelief. The attack does {@dice 4d6} psychic damage to your foe, leaving them to ponder their life decisions. They must make a wisdom saving throw, on a failure they have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, and can’t take reactions until the end of it’s next turn. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, you were a little too cocky with your move and karma is a bitch. You look down and realize you’ve stood in poo. You become too busy cleaning off your footwear to take reactions and you make all charisma checks and saves with disadvantage until the end of your next turn.

Your weapon glistens with a new, unsettling sheen—a thick, pulsating layer of otherworldly, living, slime. With each strike, the corrosive ooze splashes onto your enemy, sizzling upon contact as it weakens armor. For the next minute, or until you smite again, each time you make a successful attack with the weapon used for this smite, the slime corrodes the armor of your foe, reducing its AC by 1. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1 you must make a Dexterity saving throw each time this happens to avoid the splash and have your armor reduced as well. Armor damaged in this way can be repaired over the course of a short rest with an appropriate tools or skill check, or by using magical repair.

The air around you becomes thick, and then, in an instant, everyone is elsewhere. It's as though some grand celestial hand reached down to rearrange the pieces on the board of reality. The choice of new positions may fall into hands both favorable and unfavorable. Everybody within 45 ft of you swaps places. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, the target of your smite decides the new position of each creature. On 2-5 it is random. On 6-8 you decide.

A mysterious chest or arcane sigil materializes before you, opening to reveal an item gleaming with magical energy. For a fleeting moment, you feel a connection to the object as if you've always known it, no attunement required. {@filter A random rare quality item|items|Rarity=rare}, determined by the DM, appears in your possession and is ready to use until your next short or long rest, at which point it disappears. If it would normally require attunement, this one does not. Roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, you become unattuned to a random item.

Gamble of the Gods. Reality blurs, and you find yourself standing before a monolithic slot machine, its levers and dials exuding an otherworldly glow. Time holds its breath as you pull the lever. The celestial cogs turn, deciding whether you'll reap untold rewards or face dire consequences. Roll {@dice 3d6}. If all three results are the same number, you, and anyone you designate in your aura, gain the benefits of a long rest. If all three results are 1, everyone within 5 feet of you, including you, drop to 1 hp.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Loves Me!
entries: {@i 15th-Level Oath of the Unpredictable Feature}

You become a veritable nexus of arcane affinity, a focal point where the unpredictable currents of magic swirl and converge. Your very presence seems to lure magical energy towards you, and this energy spills over to those near you. When you or an ally within the aura of your influence casts a spell that targets only a single creature, the arcane eddies around you empower the spell to also reach out and effect an additional creature within range. (To be eligible, a spell must be incapable of targeting more than one creature at the spell's current level. For example, magic missile and scorching ray aren't eligible, but ray of frost and chromatic orb are. For the sake of this effect, ‘self’ spells are considered to be a range of ‘touch’.)

rows: A huge object nearby wakes up, ready to begin a new life. It has the ability to speak your language, and its personality is decided by the DM. Cosmic  a {@dice d10}. On 2+, for the next minute, while its connection to immaculate birth is fresh, as a bonus action, you can mentally command the now-creature you made with this effect if the creature is within 500 feet of you. You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete. It is aware of it if it is controlled in this manner. The creature-object uses the {@creature Animated Object (Huge)|PHB} stat block, but has an intelligence of 10.

A wave of scintillating energy erupts from you, enveloping all allies within 30 feet in a shimmering, kaleidoscopic aura. This aura seems to have a will of its own, batting away malevolent spells like a guardian angel warding off threats. For the next 10 minutes, or until you smite again, each friendly creature in the area (including you) has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, when an affected creature succeeds on a saving throw made against a spell or magical effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw.

I’ll have a little of that! With a mischievous glint in your eye, you extend your hand toward the hostile spellcaster, as if beckoning the very essence of their spell to bend to your will. For the next minute, or until you smite again, when you see a spell effect a hostile creature within 90 ft of you, you can choose to take it for yourself. Roll a {@dice d10}. On a 10, you steal the effect entirely. If it is a concentration spell, you are now required to maintain the concentration on it. On a 2-9, you and the original target are both affected by the spell. On a 1, the target of your smite instead gains the ability to steal a little magic intended for you. It must also roll a {@dice d10}. On a 10, it can steal the magic effect from you completely (requiring concentration if necessary), otherwise it copies the effect.

With a resounding "pop," a shimmering ice-tube materializes mid-air. An army of penguins, each donning a miniature suit of ethereal armor, bursts forth in a coordinated slide, their eyes set with adorable determination. They charge forth at your enemies. All enemies in a 50 foot cone, originating from you, towards the target of your smite, must make a Constitution saving throw. Each creature takes {@dice 6d8} cold damage and {@dice 1d10} psychic damage on a failure, or half as much on a save. Roll a {@dice d10}. On their way home, they leave you a bill for their services; 50 gp per damage dealt.

The air chills, and echoes of otherworldly whispers fill the area. For a brief second, the veil separating the world of the living and the realm of the dead grows thin, allowing their energies to intertwine. For the next hour, each corpse within 100 feet of you is under the effects of the {@spell speak with dead} spell, without a limit of the number of questions it can be asked. Furthermore, for the next minute, necrotic damage heals you. Roll a {@dice d10}. On a 1, all creatures in this area make death saves with disadvantage.

Let ‘er rrrrip! With an almost audible crackle, the air around you surges with raw, untamed magical energy. Arcane symbols flash briefly around you and your allies, as if the very rules of magic are being rewritten in real-time. Until the end of your next turn, all spells originating from within your aura with a casting time of 1 action can be cast with a bonus action, and spell slinging rules are in effect. (You can cast a leveled spell with both your bonus action and action on the same turn.)

A surge of wild magic invigorates the air, tingling your senses and those of your allies. The very fabric of reality seems to loosen, offering glimpses of distant places. For the next minute, you and allies within your aura can step through these magical folds in space, teleporting up to 60 feet as a bonus action. Roll a {@dice d10} each time a creature teleports in this way. On a 1, a creature that teleports this way finds that they didn’t maintain the correct orientation, and they awkwardly fall into the ground at their destination, ending their turn {@condition prone}.

A cacophonous rumble echoes as a volcano materializes overhead, inverted against the laws of nature. Molten rivers erupt from its summit, descending as a fiery rain to scorch all those in its path. The target of your smite must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure they take {@dice 6d6} fire damage, are on fire, and the area they stand in is now a pool of lava, and {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. On a success, they take half damage, and move to an adjacent square out of the way. A creature that is on fire, or touches the lava, takes {@dice 2d6} fire damage at the beginning of each of its turns until it, or another creature, spends an action to put the fire out. For the next minute, at the end of each of your turns, the lava pool expands its radius by 5 ft. Roll a {@dice d10}. On a 1, the initial position of the volcano expands to encompass both you and the target of your smite. You, and anyone else in this area, must also make the initial Dexterity save.

Your weapon shines with a soft, golden light as it strikes, and a wave of soothing energy emanates from you. You feel as though the strings of fate themselves have been momentarily re-tuned, selecting an ally to receive a profound renewal of body and spirit. A random ally within your aura, including possibly yourself, receives the benefit of a {@spell greater restoration}. If the creature would receive no benefit from this spell, roll a {@dice d6}. That creature’s ability stat is raised by your proficiency bonus for the next minute. Roll a {@dice d10}. On a 1, the target of your smite receives the benefit of a greater restoration and the ability score bonus.

With a whispered incantation, you channel the living essence of magic into your weapon. A radiant glow erupts from the blade, illuminating the area like a miniature sun, casting bright daylight for 60 feet and dim light for an additional 60 feet. For the next hour, or until you smite again, your attacks deal an additional {@dice 2d8} radiant damage. Roll a {@dice d10}. On a 1, the target of your smite has immunity to radiant damage for the next minute.

The impact of your weapon resonates deeper than flesh and bone; it echoes in your very soul. Hidden, dark corners of your lineage awaken as your body contorts and your eyes blaze with an unholy fire. With a guttural roar, leathery wings erupt from your back, completing your infernal transformation.. For the next minute, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, and are immune to cold, fire, and poison. You have a 40 foot fly speed, you gain devil's sight (you can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical) to 60 ft, have advantage on saves against magic, and access to the {@classFeature reckless attack|Barbarian||2} feature. You cannot cast spells in this form. Devil power never comes without its price, however. When the transformation ends, roll a {@dice d6} and make a constitution saving throw as the blood in your veins literally boils off the devilish contagions. On a failure take levels of {@condition exhaustion|PHB} equal to the {@dice d6} rolled, or half as much on a success (rounding down).

The bonds of camaraderie between you and your allies resonate with potent arcane frequencies, distorting the very land around you. Draw a line that connects each one of your party members without overlapping (the line must not cross itself). This does not include NPCs or summoned creatures. Small objects nearby quiver, then float, as if caught in a spider's web of invisible energy. Any creatures of your choice that are within the area, or touching the line, of the resulting polygon must make a Constitution saving throw. Physics pulls gravity in all directions dealing {@dice 5d12} force damage to all creatures who failed the save, or half as much on a success. Each creature is tossed 15 ft in a random direction. The entire landscape is flattened to the lowest level of elevation within the shape, and each creature is knocked {@condition prone} regardless of the outcome of their saving throw. Roll a {@dice d10}. On a 1, you and your party must all make the Constitution save as well.

As your weapon lands its blow, a profound aura of life emanates from you, reaching out to the spirits recently departed. Cosmic energies gather, weaving new forms for the souls to inhabit. The air fills with the scent of fresh rain and spring blossoms as the dead are granted a new lease on life. All dead creatures of your choice within your aura are instantaneously reincarnated. You roll three times on the races table for each of them, and choose the outcome. Roll a {@dice d10}. On a 1, all creatures in your aura are reincarnated, and are randomly decided by the GM.

The beat down stick. Your weapon roils with reductive energy and now holds the power to deflate egos and sizes alike. For the next minute, the first time on each of your turns that you land a successful weapon attack with the weapon you used to smite, you reduce the size of your opponent by 1 category for the next hour (this is a cumulative effect). If the creature is already tiny sized when this happens, they are batted {@dice 1d12} * 5 feet away from you. If they would strike an object or creature, they take {@dice 1d6} damage for each 10 feet traveled, and fall {@condition prone}. If they struck another creature, they each take the damage and fall {@condition prone}. Roll a {@dice d10}. On a 1, the target of your smite also has a beat down stick.

You become one with the god damn force, and for the next 10 minutes, or until you smite again, can move creatures with nothing but your mind. Make a Charisma save contested by the target of your smite's Strength save. If you win the contest, you move the creature up to 30 feet in any direction, including upward. Until the end of your next turn, the creature is {@condition restrained|PHB} in your telekinetic grip. A creature lifted upward is suspended in mid-air. On subsequent rounds, you can use your bonus action to attempt to maintain your telekinetic grip on the creature by repeating the contest, or you may choose another creature. Roll a {@dice d10}. On a 1, it is instead the target of your smite who becomes telekinetic.

From the very soil below, ethereal duplicates of you burst forth. They bear your armor, your weapon, and a visage of your steely resolve, each ready to deliver psychic retribution. Impeccable facsimiles of you rise up out of the ground in unoccupied squares adjacent to up to 5 enemies within 30 ft of the target of your smite. Make a spell attack for each of them that does {@dice 5d10} psychic damage. Choose one of the facsimiles. After the attacks, they all slide back into the earth, leaving you in the position of the chosen facsimile. Roll a {@dice d10}. On a 1, suffer a madness from the {@table long-term madness} table.

Impossible genius overtakes your brain, and you see behind the curtain of reality, and how time itself works. Until the end of your next turn, while you are able to contain the knowledge in your head, you are able to spend your reaction in response to a creature you can see making an attack roll or starting to cast a spell, to attempt to shunt that fucker out of time. They must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or vanish, being thrown to another point in time and causing the attack to miss or the spell to be wasted. At the start of its next turn, the target reappears where it was or in the closest unoccupied space. The target doesn't remember you casting the spell or being affected by it. Roll {@dice 2d10}. Your trifling with magic ages you by the amount rolled. If it's an odd number your age is reduced. If it is even, it is increased.

As if answering a silent summons, walls of ancient, runic stones rise from the earth at breakneck speed, enclosing you and your smite target in an otherworldly colosseum. The air thickens with the anticipation of an epic duel. You are enclosed in a 150 ft tall interdimensional ring that leaves only 5 ft around you and your foe. For the two of you, your crit-ranges reduce by 1, you make grapple checks at advantage, fall damage doubles, and your strikes deal an additional {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning damage. This effect lasts until one of you has your hp reduced to 0, fall {@condition prone}, or 1 minute passes.

Lend me your strength! All creatures within your aura may spend an amount of hit dice no higher than half their level, or CR, to add that amount of damage directly onto your smite. Roll a {@dice d10}. On a 1, a creature that spends their hit dice in this way can choose for this damage to be dealt directly to you as poison damage instead.

EPIC EXTREME BATTLE. Time seems to freeze as an overwhelming wave of adrenaline and magical energy erupts from your aura, elevating your allies to new heights of prowess. Roll another {@dice d20}. All friendly creatures within your aura may immediately use one short rest ability from their class. On 15+, all friendly creatures within your aura may immediately use a long rest ability rather than a short rest ability, regardless of its normal action economy. On a 20, you gain a 5th level spell slot. On a 1, for each ability that is used in this way, if the target of your smite can see the creature, they can choose to target themselves with the same ability, at the same time.

subclassFeature.name: Luck is on my side!
entries: {@i 20th-Level Oath of the Unpredictable Feature}

Using your action, you link yourself to what cannot possibly be known, and take matters into your own hands. Luck, or magic at the very least, is always on your side in this form, protecting you from your biggest missteps. As you activate this divine gambit, you can almost feel the cosmos holding its breath, watching as you dance on the knife's edge between disaster and unparalleled triumph.

For the next hour, any time you roll a 1, you can instead treat it as a critical success, and as the highest number on the die rolled. Furthermore, you now achieve critical success on rolls of 18 or higher. Lastly, you roll on any one Wild Magic Paladin Smite Effects table that you wish on each successful attack you make. You can be affected by up to two effects that 'end when you next smite' at a time, losing the older effect on each occurrence.
